description: cmd/dist: allow assembly code to use enumerated constants.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://khr%40golang.org@code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM

Fine, although for things outside pkg/runtime I expect we'll just keep
using #defines in .h files.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=479890e74f24 ***

cmd/dist: allow assembly code to use enumerated constants.

R=golang-dev, rsc
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/11056044

Was thinking a little more about this. Depending on how it ends up getting
used we may want to drop the const_ prefix. But let's wait and see how it
gets used.

Russ

subject: code review 11056044: cmd/dist: allow assembly code to use enumerated constants.
